dataset.title: Homestead Exclusion for a Veteran with a Disability
dataset.description:
The Disabled Veterans program provides a market value exclusion for property tax purposes for the homestead property of an honorably discharged veteran who has a service-connected disability rating of 70 percent or higher, as determined by the U.S. Department or Veterans Affairs. A verification letter from the Veterans Administration must accompany the application. The qualified veteran or surviving spouse is still responsible for disclosing any change that may disqualify them from the exclusion. 


Qualifying veterans who are 70 percent disabled or more are eligible for a maximum exclusion of $150,000. Qualifying veterans who are permanently 100 percent disabled are eligible for a maximum $300,000 market value exclusion. For additional information regarding the market value exclusion for veterans with a disability, please view the Minnesota Department Of Revenue's website.

dataset.title: Special Agricultural Homestead - Trust Owned
dataset.description:
To qualify, property must be:

  • Classified as agricultural
  • At least 40 acres in size
  • Farmed by a qualifying person or qualifying relative
    • A qualifying relative is a child, grandchild, sibling, or parent of the owner or the owner’s spouse
  • Actively farmed by someone who:
    • Participates in the day-to-day labor, decision making, and management of the claimed homestead
    • Assumes all or part of the financial risks of the farm
    • Lives near the agricultural property
Note: Actively farmed does not apply to occupied entity-owned agricultural property.

Special agricultural applications must be completed annually and returned required documentation. For additional information regarding the special agricultural application, please review the Minnesota Department of Revenue website.

dataset.title: Blind & Disabled Homestead Application
dataset.description:
The special homestead classification, class 1b property, is available for persons who are blind or disabled. The property owner or owner's spouse may qualify to receive a decrease in property taxes if:
  • The applicant is legally blind.
  • The applicant is totally and permanently disabled.
Real estate that is occupied and used as a homestead by a blind/disabled relative of the property owner can qualify as class 1b property. In order to qualify for the special homestead, the relative living in the home must be the qualifying blind/disabled person. Qualifying relatives for both agricultural and residential homestead include: parent, stepparent, child, stepchild, grandparents, grandchild, brother, sister, uncle, aunt, nephew or niece of the owner, by blood or marriage.

Required documentation must be submitted with your application. For additional information regarding the special homestead classification for persons who are blind & disabled, please review the Minnesota Department of Revenue's website.

dataset.title: Homestead Exclusion for a Surviving Spouse of a Veteran
dataset.description:
Surviving spouses of veterans may be eligible for a market value exclusion of up to $300,000 if either of following apply:
  • Surviving spouse of a United States military veteran with 100% and permanent service-connected disability or you have been awarded dependency and indemnity compensation. 
  • Surviving spouse of a member of the United States Armed Forces who died due to a service connected cause while serving honorably in active duty, as indicated on U.S. Government Form DD1300 or DD2064.
A verification letter from the Veterans Administration must accompany the application. The surviving spouse is still responsible for disclosing any change that may disqualify them from the exclusion..

For additional information regarding the market value exclusion for surviving spouses of veterans with a disability, please view the Minnesota Department Of Revenue's website.

dataset.title: Homestead Exclusion for a Primary Caregiver of a Veteran
dataset.description:
You may be eligible for a market value exclusion of up to:
  • $150,000 if you are the primary caregiver of a U.S. military veteran with a service-connected disability of 70% or more
  • $300,000 if you are the primary family caregiver of a U.S. military veteran with a 100% and permanent service-connected disability
You must be able to verify honorable discharge status of the veteran from the U.S. Armed Forces and be certified by the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) as having service-connected disability.

For additional information regarding the market value exclusion for primary caregivers of veterans with a disability, please view the Minnesota Department Of Revenue's website.

dataset.title: Homestead Application
dataset.description:
If you own and occupy your property or if you own property that a qualifying relative occupies, you may be eligible to receive the homestead classification. Property must be owned and occupied as a primary residence of the owner or qualifying relative no later than December 31 of the current year to receive homestead for taxes payable next year. For information about the benefits of homestead, please review the Minnesota Department of Revenue's Homestead Classification website. 

A qualifying relative includes: parent, stepparent, child, stepchild, grandparent, grandchild, brother, sister, uncle, aunt, nephew, or niece of the owner, by blood or marriage.

dataset.title: Special Agricultural Homestead - Reapplication, Entity Owned
dataset.description:
If there are no changes in ownership, occupancy or other status changes of agricultural property, the reapplication can be used. 

To qualify, property must be:

  • Classified as agricultural
  • At least 40 acres in size
  • Farmed by a qualifying person or qualifying relative
    • A qualifying relative is a child, grandchild, sibling, or parent of the owner or the owner’s spouse
  • Actively farmed by someone who:
    • Participates in the day-to-day labor, decision making, and management of the claimed homestead
    • Assumes all or part of the financial risks of the farm
    • Lives near the agricultural property
Note: Actively farmed does not apply to occupied entity-owned agricultural property.

Special agricultural applications must be completed annually and returned required documentation. For additional information regarding the special agricultural application, please review the Minnesota Department of Revenue website.
